title: Advertising Revenue To Be a Focal Point in Alphabet's Q3
text: The company's advertising results will undoubtedly be a critical metric of the release, as it's a massive source of the company's revenue.

title: Confidential Computing Presents Unique Opportunities for Technology Investors
text: Confidential computing is a cutting-edge technology that protects the most sensitive information by focusing on data protection with hardware-based trusted execution environments. This emerging security model is in high demand today as more data-driven businesses migrate to the cloud, particularly in highly regulated industries such as banking, which deal with large volumes of extremely confidential data.

title: Google faces an advertising slowdown — here's why earnings may hold up anyway
text: It's been a challenging year for digital advertising, and the worst may be yet to come.

title: Big-Tech Earnings Week Commences
text: We have another big week in store for the major market indices, when the stocks formerly known as FANG (or at least some of them) report earnings results.

title: Alphabet's strong cash position puts Google parent on firm third-quarter footing
text: In the build up to Google parent Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG)'s third-quarter trading statement on Tuesday October 25, Zacks Investment Research maintains a consensus revenues estimate of US$58.35bn, indicating an 8.8% improvement year on year. “Alphabet's robust Search segment continues to be the key catalyst for its top-line growth.

title: Tech Earnings On Tap
text: Some of the world's largest tech companies report earnings this week, including Apple, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, Microsoft, and Amazon.

title: Google sets up high-tech school at Israeli University
text: Alphabet Inc's Google and Israel's Reichman University have set up a school to train high-tech professionals, offering courses in computer programming, sales and data analysis among other subjects, the university said on Monday.

title: Facebook and Google face skeptics on Wall Street this week amid digital ads collapse
text: Following Snap's disappointing earnings report last week, investors turn their focus to Meta and Alphabet as they look for signs of recovery in online ads.

title: 2 Top Growth Stocks Near a 52-Week Low to Buy Now and Hold For the Long Term
text: These growth stocks have fallen hard this year, but that creates a buying opportunity for patient investors.

title: 2 Dirt-Cheap Stock-Split Stocks You'll Regret Not Buying and 1 You'll Be Glad You Avoided
text: More than 200 stock splits have taken place this year -- but not all stock-split stocks are created equally.
